00010 
00011 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00012 // A <code>DefaultMutableTreeNode</code> is a general-purpose node in a tree data
00013 // structure. A tree node may have at most one parent and 0 or more children.
00014 // <code>DefaultMutableTreeNode</code> provides operations for examining and modifying a
00015 // node's parent and children and also operations for examining the tree that
00016 // the node is a part of.  A node's tree is the set of all nodes that can be
00017 // reached by starting at the node and following all the possible links to
00018 // parents and children.  A node with no parent is the root of its tree; a
00019 // node with no children is a leaf.  A tree may consist of many subtrees,
00020 // each node acting as the root for its own subtree.
00021 // <p>
00022 // While DefaultMutableTreeNode implements the MutableTreeNode interface and
00023 // will allow you to add in any implementation of MutableTreeNode not all
00024 // of the methods in DefaultMutableTreeNode will be applicable to all
00025 // StiTreeNodes implementations. Especially with some of the enumerations
00026 // that are provided, using some of these methods assumes the
00027 // DefaultMutableTreeNode contains only DefaultMutableNode instances. All
00028 // of the TreeNode/MutableTreeNode methods will behave as defined no
00029 // matter what implementations are added.
00030 // <p>
00031 //
00032 // @see StiTreeNode
00033 //
00034 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00035 
00036 
00037 class StiDefaultMutableTreeNode;
00038 typedef vector<StiDefaultMutableTreeNode *> StiDefaultMutableTreeNodeVector;
00039 typedef StiDefaultMutableTreeNodeVector::iterator StiDefaultMutableTreeNodeIterator;
